Deal with check outputs

Sébastien Rochette

2019-08-19

Source: vignettes/deal-with-check-outputs.Rmd
deal-with-check-outputs.Rmd

Packages

library(checkhelper)

Deal with check outputs

Create a fake package for examples

# Create fake package ----
tempdir <- tempdir()
# Create fake package
usethis::create_package(file.path(tempdir, "checkpackage"), open = FALSE)
#> ✔ Creating '/tmp/Rtmp3ie4hY/checkpackage/'
#> ✔ Setting active project to '/tmp/Rtmp3ie4hY/checkpackage'
#> ✔ Creating 'R/'
#> ✔ Writing 'DESCRIPTION'
#> Package: checkpackage
#> Title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
#> Version: 0.0.0.9000
#> Authors@R (parsed):
#>     * First Last <first.last@example.com> [aut, cre] (<https://orcid.org/YOUR-ORCID-ID>)
#> Description: What the package does (one paragraph).
#> License: What license it uses
#> Encoding: UTF-8
#> LazyData: true
#> ✔ Writing 'NAMESPACE'
#> ✔ Setting active project to '<no active project>'

# Create function no visible global variables and missing documented functions
cat("
#' Function
#' @importFrom dplyr filter
#' @export
my_fun <- function() {
data %>%
filter(col == 3) %>%
mutate(new_col = 1) %>%
ggplot() +
  aes(x, y, colour = new_col) +
  geom_point()
}
", file = file.path(tempdir, "checkpackage", "R", "function.R"))

path <- file.path(tempdir, "checkpackage")
attachment::att_to_description(path = path)
#> Updating checkpackage documentation
#> Updating roxygen version in /tmp/Rtmp3ie4hY/checkpackage/DESCRIPTION
#> Writing NAMESPACE
#> Loading checkpackage
#> Writing NAMESPACE
#> Writing my_fun.Rd
#> [+] 1 package(s) added: dplyr.

Use the package

# Get globals
globals <- get_no_visible(path)
#> ── R CMD build ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

globals
#> $globalVariables
#> # A tibble: 4 x 6
#>   notes           fun   is_function is_global_varia… variable proposed     
#>   <chr>           <chr> <lgl>       <lgl>            <chr>    <chr>

#> 4 my_fun: no visible… my_fun TRUE        FALSE            aes      <NA>    
#> 5 my_fun: no visible… my_fun TRUE        FALSE            geom_po… <NA>

# Print globals to copy-paste
print_globals(globals)
#> --- Fonctions to add in NAMESPACE ---
#> 
#> %>%, aes, geom_point, ggplot, mutate
#> 
#> --- Potential GlobalVariables ---
#> 
#> globalVariables(
#> c(
#> "data", "x", "y", "new_col"
#> )
#> )
# Store in package using usethis::use_r("globals")
